body: this is used in singleblock construction. not sure if you took those out. this can prob be removed, but please do a perf run with affinity to check.
Did you try removing `**kwargs` from all the block subclasses? I'm curious if anything breaks, but haven't had a chance yet.
appveyor breakage is from downstream: pyarrow passes `fastpath` to `internals.make_block`.  I can put the kwarg back in there until it can be removed downstream I guess.
@TomAugspurger Removed the `**kwargs` from the `__init__` methods, added in `ndim=None` for a few for uniformity.  Didn't break any tests.

Per usual, looks indistinguishable from noise.

@jbrockmendel these asv's are not stable from you. are you sure you are running with affinity?

> these asv's are not stable from you. are you sure you are running with affinity?

@jreback I'm pretty sure that's what the "taskset" is doing.  Is there a better way to do that?

FWIW when I tried to get dateutil to use asv we found that I wasn't the only one getting wildly unreliable results.

(I also made a brief push to get ASV to a) stagger benchmarks so as to smooth out background noise and b) aggregate stats across runs to get bigger sample sizes, but that went nowhere)
